qas.question: Similar tianguis might set up shop where?
What is the most basic way a street vendor might sell their goods?

answers.text: tarp or cloth laid on the ground

qas.question: Street vendors might sell their goods in official places as well as where?

answers.text: non-officially controlled concentrations around metro stations and hospitals

context: Street vendors play their trade from stalls in the tianguis as well as at <a2_0>non-officially controlled concentrations around metro stations and hospitals<a2_0/>; at <a0_0>plazas comerciales<a0_0/>, where vendors of a certain "theme" (e.g. stationery) are housed; originally these were organized to accommodate vendors formerly selling on the street; or simply from improvised stalls on a city sidewalk. In addition, food and goods are sold from people walking with baskets, pushing carts, from bicycles or the backs of trucks, or simply from a <a1_0>tarp or cloth laid on the ground<a1_0/>.
